001package org.hd.d.TRVmodel.hg;
002
003import java.util.Objects;
004
005/**Parameterised recreation of the heat-pump / TRV / energy interactions from Heat Geek's page:
006 * <a href="https://www.heatgeek.com/why-not-to-zone-heat-pumps-or-boilers/">https://www.heatgeek.com/why-not-to-zone-heat-pumps-or-boilers/</a>
007 * as of ~2023-06.
008 * <p>
009 * This is examining if turning down TRVs in unused rooms saves energy or not,
010 * as is commonly assumed eg with gas-fired heating.
011 * <p>
012 * Many thanks to Heat Geek for making this analysis and explanation available.
013 * <p>
014 * This is a simple model, mirroring the page above.
015 * <p>
016 * This model is steady-state, ie in temperature equilibrium.
017 * <p>
018 * Note that the calculations are all stateless,
019 * so could be memoised/cached for any particular set of input parameters.
020 */
021public final class HGTRVHPMModelParameterised
022        {
023        /**Prevent creation of an instance. */
024    private HGTRVHPMModelParameterised() { }
025
026    /**Parameters for this version of the model.
027     * Defaults should yield the same
028     *
029     * @param  doorsPerInternalWall  was 0.5 in the original page calcs (but 1 in the text);
030     *     expected to be in range [0,1], must be finite and positive
031     * @param correctCoPForFlowVsMW  if true then correct CoP flow temperature
032     *     (original page implies false)
033     * @param roomsAlternatingABAB  if true then arrange rooms to maximise internal heat transfer/loss
034     *     else arrange so as to minimise heat loss
035     *     (original page implies true)
036     * @param externalAirTemperatureC  external air temperature, degrees C;
037     *     (original page has -3&deg;C)
038     */
039    public record ModelParameters(
040                double doorsPerInternalWall,
041                boolean correctCoPForFlowVsMW,
042                boolean roomsAlternatingABAB,
043                double externalAirTemperatureC
044                )
045            {
046        /**Construct instance. */
047        public ModelParameters
048                        {
049                // Sanity-check parameters.
050                if(!Double.isFinite(doorsPerInternalWall)) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
051                if(doorsPerInternalWall < 0) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
052                        }
053
054        /**All-defaults parameter set the should produce original model results. */
055        public ModelParameters()
056                {
057                this(
058                        DEFAULT_DOORS_PER_INTERNAL_WALL,
059                        DEFAULT_CORRECT_COP_FOR_FLOW_TEMPERATURE,
060                        DEFAULT_ARRANGEMENT_ABAB,
061                        DEFAULT_EXTERNAL_AIR_TEMPERATURE_C
062                        );
063                }
064
065        /**Allow doors per internal wall to be set, all else defaults.
066         * @param doorsPerInternalWall  mean number of doors per internal wall (non-negative)
067         * @param correctCoPForFlowVsMW  if true, correct for flow vs mean radiator issue
068         */
069        public ModelParameters(final double doorsPerInternalWall, final boolean correctCoPForFlowVsMW)
070            { this(doorsPerInternalWall, correctCoPForFlowVsMW, DEFAULT_ARRANGEMENT_ABAB, DEFAULT_EXTERNAL_AIR_TEMPERATURE_C); }
071
072        /**Allow doors per internal wall to be set, all else defaults.
073         * @param doorsPerInternalWall  mean number of doors per internal wall (non-negative)
074         */
075        public ModelParameters(final double doorsPerInternalWall)
076            { this(doorsPerInternalWall, DEFAULT_CORRECT_COP_FOR_FLOW_TEMPERATURE); }
077
078
079        /**Clone but replace external temperature value; all other parameters unchanged.
080         * @param newExternalTemperature  the temperature to use (C)
081         * @return adjusted model parameters; not null
082         */
083        public ModelParameters cloneWithAdjustedExternalTemperature(final double newExternalTemperature)
084                {
085                if(!Double.isFinite(newExternalTemperature)) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
086                return(new ModelParameters(
087                                doorsPerInternalWall,
088                                correctCoPForFlowVsMW,
089                                roomsAlternatingABAB,
090                                newExternalTemperature));
091                }
092
093
094        /**Default doors per internal wall: matches the 0.5 in calcs on the original page. */
095        public static final double DEFAULT_DOORS_PER_INTERNAL_WALL = 0.5;
096        /**Default correction for CoP for flow rather than radiator mean water temperature. */
097        public static final boolean DEFAULT_CORRECT_COP_FOR_FLOW_TEMPERATURE = false;
098        /**Default room arrangement ABAB (vs AABB) alternating as original calcs. */
099        public static final boolean DEFAULT_ARRANGEMENT_ABAB = true;
100        /**Default external temperature (C). */
101        public static final double DEFAULT_EXTERNAL_AIR_TEMPERATURE_C = HGTRVHPMModel.EXTERNAL_AIR_TEMPERATURE_C;
102
103        /**Fixed doors per internal wall: matches the 1 in text on the original page. */
104        public static final double FIXED_DOORS_PER_INTERNAL_WALL = 1.0;
105        /**Fixed correction for CoP for flow rather than radiator mean water temperature. */
106        public static final boolean FIXED_CORRECT_COP_FOR_FLOW_TEMPERATURE = true;
107        /**Version of parameters with fixes applied but no other changes from defaults. */
108        public static final ModelParameters FIXES_APPLIED =
109                        new ModelParameters(
110                        ModelParameters.FIXED_DOORS_PER_INTERNAL_WALL,
111                        ModelParameters.FIXED_CORRECT_COP_FOR_FLOW_TEMPERATURE);
112
113        /**AABB minimal-loss room arrangement. */
114        public static final ModelParameters FIXES_AND_AABB =
115                        new ModelParameters(
116                        ModelParameters.FIXED_DOORS_PER_INTERNAL_WALL,
117                        ModelParameters.FIXED_CORRECT_COP_FOR_FLOW_TEMPERATURE,
118                        false,
119                        DEFAULT_EXTERNAL_AIR_TEMPERATURE_C);
120            }
121
122    /**Heat demand and the electricity input to the heat pump to meet it (W).
123     * @param heatDemand  raw heat demand to maintain home temperature; finite, non-negative
124     * @param heatPumpElectricity  electricity into the heat pump to maintain home temperature; finite, non-negative
125     */
126    public record HeatAndElectricityDemand(double heatDemand, double heatPumpElectricity)
127            {
128        /**Construct instance. */
129            public HeatAndElectricityDemand
130                    {
131                // Sanity-check parameters.
132                if(!Double.isFinite(heatDemand)) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
133                if(heatDemand < 0) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
134                if(!Double.isFinite(heatPumpElectricity)) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
135                if(heatPumpElectricity < 0) { throw new IllegalArgumentException(); }
136                    }
137            }
138
139    /**Home heat and electricity demand with and without setback in B rooms; both non-null.
140     * @param noSetback  non-set-back values; non-null
141     * @param withSetback  set-back values; non-null
142     */
143    public record DemandWithoutAndWithSetback(HeatAndElectricityDemand noSetback, HeatAndElectricityDemand withSetback)
144            {
145        /**Construct instance. */
146        public DemandWithoutAndWithSetback
147                {
148                Objects.requireNonNull(noSetback);
149                Objects.requireNonNull(withSetback);
150                }
151            }
152
153    /**Estimate the CoP for a given flow temperature (C) given the two supplied data points.
154     * This does a simple linear fit, which is not perfect but probably adequate.
155     * <p>
156     * Note this is for flow temperature, given the sample manufacturer's data,
157     * though the original text uses this interchangeably with mid temperature.
158     *
159     * @param flowC  flow temperature (from heat pump to radiator) in C
160     * @return CoP
161     */
162    public static double computeFlowCoP(final double flowC)
163            {
164        final double tempDeltaK = HGTRVHPMModel.CoPHt - HGTRVHPMModel.CoPLt;
165        final double CoPDelta = HGTRVHPMModel.CoPH - HGTRVHPMModel.CoPL;
166
167        final double CoP = HGTRVHPMModel.CoPL +
168                        ((flowC - HGTRVHPMModel.CoPLt) * (CoPDelta / tempDeltaK));
169
170        return(CoP);
171            }
172
173    /**Assumed delta between MW and flow temperature with 5K system delta (K). */
174    public static final double flowMWDelta_K = 2.5;
175
176    /**Compute the original HG 4-room 'bungalow' heat-pump electricity demand (W); zero or more.
177     * The calculation uses constants from HGTRVHPMModel as far as possible,
178     * substituting in parameters and new calculation where needed.
179     *
180     * @param params  the variable model parameters
181     * @param withBSetback  if true, with B rooms set back, else all at same temperature
182     * @return demand in watts, finite and non-negative
183     */
184    public static double computeBungalowHPElectricityDemandW(final ModelParameters params, final boolean withBSetback)
185            {
186        Objects.requireNonNull(params);
187        return(withBSetback ?
188                        computeBungalowDemandW(params).withSetback.heatPumpElectricity :
189                        computeBungalowDemandW(params).noSetback.heatPumpElectricity);
190            }
191
192    /**Radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B setback (C) for 'stiff' regulation.
193     * @param HHLsb  whole home heat loss with B rooms setback and given external air temperature (W)
194     * @param radWnsb  pre-setback radiator output based on variable external air temperature (W)
195     * @param IWFAabHLW  internal wall/floor heat loss/transfer per A room (W)
196     * @return (radAMWsb) mean water temperature in each A room when B setback (C)
197     */
198        public static double sbAMW(final double HHLsb, final double radWnsb, final double IWFAabHLW)
199                {
200                // radWAsb: (Heat Loss 2.0) radiator output in each A room when B setback (W).
201        // (RADIATOR_POWER_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_W)
202        final double radWAsb =
203                //HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_POWER_WITH_HOME_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W + IDWAabHLW;
204                radWnsb + IWFAabHLW;
205        // radWBsb: (Heat Loss 2.0) radiator output in each B room when B setback (W).
206        // (Was: RADIATOR_POWER_IN_B_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_W)
207        // radWAmultsb: (Heat Loss 2.1) radiator output increase multiplier in each A room when B setback.
208        // (RADIATOR_POWER_UPLIFT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_MULTIPLIER)
209        final double radWAmultsb =
210                radWAsb / HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_POWER_WITH_HOME_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W;
211        // radAdTmultsb: (Heat Loss 2.3) radiator MW-AT delta-T increase multiplier in each A room when B setback.
212        // (RADIATOR_DT_UPLIFT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_MULTIPLIER)
213        final double radAdTmultsb =
214                Math.pow(radWAmultsb, HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_EXP_POWER_TO_DT);
215        // radAdTsb: (Heat Loss 2.4) radiator MW-AT delta-T in each A room when B setback (K).
216        // (RADIATOR_DT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_K)
217        final double radAdTsb =
218                HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_MWATDT_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_K * radAdTmultsb;
219        // radAMWsb: (Heat Loss 2.5) radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B setback (C).
220        // (RADIATOR_MW_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_C)
221        final double radAMWsb =
222                HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C + radAdTsb;
223//System.out.println(String.format("radAMWsb = %.1f", radAMWsb));
224                return(radAMWsb);
225                }
226
227    /**Internal wall heat loss/transfer per A room (HEAT LOSS 1) with A at 'normal' temperature (W).     *
228     * @param params  the model parameters; never null
229     * @return heat loss power per A rooms (W)
230     */
231        private static double iwHeatLossPerA(final ModelParameters params)
232                {
233                return(iwHeatLossPerA(params, HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C));
234                }
235
236    /**Internal wall heat loss/transfer per A room (HEAT LOSS 1) (W).
237     * This allows an A room temperature other than the initial 'normal' 21C,
238     * though it must still be above the B room setback temperature.
239     *
240     * @param params  the model parameters; never null
241     * @param tempA  the A room temperature in C; no lower than B (and finite)
242     * @return heat loss power per A rooms (W)
243     */
244        private static double iwHeatLossPerA(final ModelParameters params, final double tempA)
245            {
246                Objects.requireNonNull(params);
247                if(!(tempA >= HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)) { throw new IllegalArgumentException("A must be warmer than B"); }
248
249                // IWAabmd: (Heat Loss 1.2) internal wall area between each A and adjoining B rooms minus appropriate amount of door (m^2).
250        // (INTERNAL_WALL_AREA_FROM_EACH_A_TO_B_ROOMS_MINUS_DOOR_M2)
251        final double IWAabmd =
252                        HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_WALL_AREA_FROM_EACH_A_TO_B_ROOM_M2
253                        - (2 * params.doorsPerInternalWall() * HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_DOOR_AREA_PER_DOOR_M2);
254        // IWAabHL: (Heat Loss 1.3) internal wall (minus door) heat loss per Kelvin (W/K).
255        // (INTERNAL_WALL_MINUS_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK)
256        final double IWAabHL =
257                IWAabmd * HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_WALL_U_WpM2K;
258        // IWAabHLW: (Heat Loss 1.4) internal wall (minus door) heat loss (W).
259        // (INTERNAL_WALL_MINUS_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_W)
260        final double IWAabHLW =
261                IWAabHL *
262                        (tempA - HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C);
263        // IDAabHL: (Heat Loss 1.5) internal door heat loss per door per Kelvin (W/K).
264        // (INTERNAL_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK)
265        final double IDAabHL =
266                HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_DOOR_AREA_PER_DOOR_M2 * HGTRVHPMModel.INTERNAL_DOOR_U_WpM2K;
267        // IDAabHLW: (Heat Loss 1.6) internal door heat loss per door (W).
268        // (INTERNAL_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_W)
269        final double IDAabHLW =
270                IDAabHL *
271                    (tempA - HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C);
272        // IDWAabHLW: (Heat Loss 1.7) internal wall and door heat loss per A room (W).
273        // (INTERNAL_WALL_AND_DOOR_HEAT_LOSS_PER_A_ROOM_W)
274        // In the original ABAB arrangement there are two walls from each A room into B rooms.
275        // In the alternate AABB arrangement there is one wall from each A room into a B room.
276        // Thus AABB has half the internal heat loss of ABAB.
277        final double IDWAabHLW = ((params.roomsAlternatingABAB()) ? 1 : 0.5) *
278                        (IWAabHLW + (2 * params.doorsPerInternalWall() * IDAabHLW));
279
280// DHD20231127: bug present in V0.9.4 ie missing brackets around wall and door terms // ((params.roomsAlternatingABAB()) ? 1 : 0.5) * /*(*/ IWAabHLW + (2 * params.doorsPerInternalWall() * IDAabHLW) /*)*/;
281
282                return(IDWAabHLW);
283            }
284
285    /**Internal floor/ceiling heat loss/transfer per A room (W) for 2-storey detached with stiff regulation.
286     * Only applies when a B room is directly above or below.
287     * <p>
288     * This is only for a 2-storey detached, so in an ABAB arrangement (with BABA below)
289     * each A room will lose each <em>either</em> to a B room below or above (not both).
290     * Heat loss in each direction (up or down) is treated as the same.
291     * <p>
292     * Assumes that A room is at 'normal' temperature and B room is at setback temperature.
293     *
294     * @param params  model parameters; non-null
295     * @return heat loss power per A rooms (W)
296     */
297        private static double ifHeatLossPerA2Storey(final ModelParameters params)
298                {
299                return(ifHeatLossPerA2Storey(params, HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C));
300                }
301
302    /**Internal floor/ceiling heat loss/transfer per A room (W) for 2-storey detached.
303     * Only applies when a B room is directly above or below.
304     * <p>
305     * This is only for a 2-storey detached, so in an ABAB arrangement (with BABA below)
306     * each A room will lose each <em>either</em> to a B room below or above (not both).
307     * Heat loss in each direction (up or down) is treated as the same.
308     *
309     * @param params  model parameters; non-null
310     * @param tempA  temperature of A room, must be no lower than B room setback.
311     * @return heat loss power per A rooms (W)
312     */
313        private static double ifHeatLossPerA2Storey(final ModelParameters params, final double tempA)
314                {
315                if(!(tempA >= HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)) { throw new IllegalArgumentException("A must be warmer than B"); }
316
317                if(!params.roomsAlternatingABAB) { return(0); }
318
319        // IFAabHL: internal floor/ceiling heat loss per Kelvin (W/K).
320        final double IFAabHL =
321                HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.PER_A_FLOOR_AREA_M2 * HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.INTERNAL_FLOOR_U_WpM2K;
322
323        // IFAabHLW: internal floor/ceiling heat loss per A room (W).
324        final double IFAabHLW =
325                IFAabHL *
326                        (tempA - HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C);
327
328                return(IFAabHLW);
329                }
330
331        /**Compute radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B is NOT set back (C).
332         * Extension to heat loss 2 to allow for varying external temperatures.
333         * <p>
334         * This is in fact the MW temperature for all room radiators when there are no setbacks.
335         * This works for stiff and soft regulation cases therefore.
336         *
337         * @param radWnsb  pre-setback radiator output based on variable external air temperature (W)
338         * @return (radAnsbMW) radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B is NOT set back (C)
339         */
340        public static double nsbAMW(final double radWnsb)
341                {
342                // Extension to heat loss 2 to allow for varying external temperatures.
343        // Compute, for when B rooms are not set back:
344        //   * the needed power for each A radiator
345        //   * thus the implied radiator mean water temperature
346                //
347                // This then allows computing:
348        //   * the CoP
349        //   * the heat-pump electricity demand
350        //
351        // Replaces the simple calc;
352//     final double radAMW =
353//         HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C + HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_MWATDT_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_K;
354        //
355        // radWAnsbmult: (Heat Loss 2.1) radiator output (possibly < 1) multiplier in each A room when B is not setback.
356        // (RADIATOR_POWER_UPLIFT_IN_A_ROOMS_WHEN_B_SETBACK_MULTIPLIER)
357        final double radWAnsbmult =
358                radWnsb / HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_POWER_WITH_HOME_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W;
359//System.out.println(String.format("radWAnsbmult = %f", radWAnsbmult));
360
361                // radAnsbdTmult: radiator MW-AT delta-T multiplier in each A room when B NOT setback.
362                final double radAnsbdTmult =
363                        Math.pow(radWAnsbmult, HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_EXP_POWER_TO_DT);
364                // radAnsbdT: radiator MW-AT delta-T in each A room when B NOT setback (K).
365                final double radAnsbdT =
366                        HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_MWATDT_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_K * radAnsbdTmult;
367                // radAnsbMW: radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B NOT setback (C).
368                final double radAnsbMW =
369                        HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C + radAnsbdT;
370//System.out.println(String.format("radAnsbMW = %.1f", radAnsbMW));
371                return(radAnsbMW);
372                }
373
374    /**Compute the original HG 4-room 'bungalow' raw heat and heat-pump electricity demand with and without B-room setback (W) with 'stiff' regulation.
375     * The calculation uses constants from HGTRVHPMModel as far as possible,
376     * substituting in parameters and new calculation where needed.
377     *
378     * @param params  the variable model parameters
379     * @return demand in watts, finite and non-negative
380     */
381    public static DemandWithoutAndWithSetback computeBungalowDemandW(final ModelParameters params)
382            {
383        Objects.requireNonNull(params);
384
385
386        // Do not allow model to be run with potentially implausible parameters.
387        if(params.externalAirTemperatureC >= HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)
388            { throw new UnsupportedOperationException("model may not work when outside is warmer than setback rooms"); }
389
390
391        // HHLnsb: whole home heat loss with no setback (all rooms same temperature) and given external air temperature (W).
392        final double HHLnsb = (HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
393                        HGTRVHPMModel.HOME_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK;
394        // HHLsb: whole home heat loss with B rooms setback and given external air temperature (W).
395        final double HHLsb = (HGTRVHPMModel.MEAN_HOME_TEMPERATURE_WITH_SETBACK_C - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
396                        HGTRVHPMModel.HOME_HEAT_LOSS_PER_KELVIN_WpK;
397                // radWnbs: (Flow Temperature, step 1) pre-setback radiator output based on variable external air temperature (W).
398        // (Was: RADIATOR_POWER_WITH_HOME_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W.)
399                final double radWnsb = HHLnsb / 4;
400
401
402        // HEAT LOSS 1
403                // Internal wall heat loss/transfer per A room (W).
404        final double IDWAabHLW = iwHeatLossPerA(params);
405
406
407        // HEAT LOSS 2
408        // radAMWsb: (Heat Loss 2.5) radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B setback (C).
409        final double radAMWsb = sbAMW(HHLsb, radWnsb, IDWAabHLW);
410                // Extension to heat loss 2 to allow for varying external temperatures.
411        final double radAMWnsb = nsbAMW(radWnsb);
412
413        // Compute correction for across-radiator delta-T if needed.
414        final double CoPCorrectionK = params.correctCoPForFlowVsMW() ? flowMWDelta_K : 0;
415
416                // HPinWnsb: (Heat Pump Efficiency) heat-pump electrical power in when B not setback (W).
417        // (HEAT_PUMP_POWER_IN_NO_SETBACK_W)
418        // Note that flow and mean temperatures seem to be being mixed here in the HG page.
419        final double CoPnsb = computeFlowCoP(radAMWnsb + CoPCorrectionK);
420//System.out.println(String.format("CoPnsb = %f", CoPnsb));
421        final double HPinWnsb =
422                HHLnsb / CoPnsb;
423
424                // HPinWsb: (Heat Pump Efficiency) heat-pump electrical power in when B is setback (W).
425        // (HEAT_PUMP_POWER_IN_B_SETBACK_W)
426        // Note that flow and mean temperatures seem to be being mixed here in the HG page.
427        final double CoPsb = computeFlowCoP(radAMWsb + CoPCorrectionK);
428//System.out.println(String.format("CoPsb = %f", CoPsb));
429        final double HPinWsb =
430                HHLsb / CoPsb;
431
432
433        final HeatAndElectricityDemand noSetback = new HeatAndElectricityDemand(HHLnsb, HPinWnsb);
434        final HeatAndElectricityDemand withSetback = new HeatAndElectricityDemand(HHLsb, HPinWsb);
435
436        // Return everything at once.
437        return(new DemandWithoutAndWithSetback(noSetback, withSetback));
438            }
439
440    /**Compute 8-room detached 2-storey house raw heat and heat-pump electricity demand with and without B-room setback with stiff regulation (W).
441     * The calculation uses constants from HGTRVHPMModel as far as possible,
442     * substituting in parameters and new calculation where needed.
443     *
444     * @param params  the variable model parameters
445     * @return demand in watts, finite and non-negative
446     */
447    public static DemandWithoutAndWithSetback computeDetachedDemandW(final ModelParameters params)
448        { return(computeDetachedDemandW(params, false)); }
449
450    /**Compute 8-room detached 2-storey house raw heat and heat-pump electricity demand with and without B-room setback with stiff regulation (W).
451     * The calculation uses constants from HGTRVHPMModel as far as possible,
452     * substituting in parameters and new calculation where needed.
453     *
454     * @param params  the variable model parameters
455     * @param asBungalow  if true, compute as 4-room bungalow to cross-check with original calculation
456     * @return demand in watts, finite and non-negative
457     */
458    public static DemandWithoutAndWithSetback computeDetachedDemandW(final ModelParameters params,
459                final boolean asBungalow)
460            {
461        Objects.requireNonNull(params);
462
463        // Do not allow model to be run with potentially implausible parameters.
464        if(params.externalAirTemperatureC >= HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)
465            { throw new UnsupportedOperationException("model may not work when outside is warmer than setback rooms"); }
466
467
468        // Roof area: as for bungalow.
469        final double roofAreaM2 = HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.HOME_TOTAL_ROOF_AREA_M2;
470
471        // Number of rooms.
472        final int numRooms = asBungalow ? 4 : 8;
473
474        // External wall area: as for bungalow in bungalow mode, else double.
475        final double extWallAreaM2 = (asBungalow ? 1 : 2) *
476                        HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.HOME_TOTAL_EXTERNAL_WALL_AREA_M2;
477
478        // Wall heat loss per K temperature differential between inside and out.
479        final double homeHeatLossPerK = (roofAreaM2 + extWallAreaM2) *
480                        HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.HOME_LOSSLESS_FLOOR_EXTERNAL_WALL_AND_ROOF_U_WpM2K;
481
482        // DHHLnsb: whole home heat loss with no setback (all rooms same temperature) and given external air temperature (W).
483        final double DHHLnsb = (HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
484                        homeHeatLossPerK;
485        // HHLsb: whole home heat loss with B rooms setback and given external air temperature (W).
486        final double DHHLsb = (HGTRVHPMModel.MEAN_HOME_TEMPERATURE_WITH_SETBACK_C - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
487                        homeHeatLossPerK;
488        // DradWnsb: pre-setback radiator output based on variable external air temperature (W).
489        // (Was: RADIATOR_POWER_WITH_HOME_AT_NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_W.)
490                final double DradWnsb = DHHLnsb / numRooms;
491//System.out.println(String.format("DradWnsb = %f", DradWnsb));
492
493                // HEAT LOSS 1
494                // Internal wall heat loss/transfer per A room (W).
495        final double DIWAabHLW = iwHeatLossPerA(params);
496                // Internal floor/ceiling heat loss/transfer per A room (W).
497        // None if a bungalow or if AABB arrangement on both floors,
498        // ie no A and B share a ceiling/floor.
499        final double DIFAabHLW =
500                        (asBungalow || !params.roomsAlternatingABAB) ? 0 :
501                                ifHeatLossPerA2Storey(params);
502        // All internal heat losses per A room (W).
503        final double DIFWAabHLW = DIWAabHLW + DIFAabHLW;
504
505
506        // HEAT LOSS 2
507        // DradAMWsb: (Heat Loss 2.5) radiator mean water temperature in each A room when B setback (C).
508        final double DradAMWsb = sbAMW(DHHLsb, DradWnsb, DIFWAabHLW);
509                // Extension to heat loss 2 to allow for varying external temperatures.
510                // MW temperature for all room radiators with no setbacks.
511        final double DradAMWnsb = nsbAMW(DradWnsb);
512
513        // Compute correction for across-radiator delta-T if needed.
514        final double CoPCorrectionK = params.correctCoPForFlowVsMW() ? flowMWDelta_K : 0;
515
516                // HPinWnsb: (Heat Pump Efficiency) heat-pump electrical power in when B not setback (W).
517        // (HEAT_PUMP_POWER_IN_NO_SETBACK_W)
518        // Note that flow and mean temperatures seem to be being mixed here in the HG page.
519        final double DCoPnsb = computeFlowCoP(DradAMWnsb + CoPCorrectionK);
520//System.out.println(String.format("CoPnsb = %f", CoPnsb));
521        final double DHPinWnsb =
522                DHHLnsb / DCoPnsb;
523
524                // HPinWsb: (Heat Pump Efficiency) heat-pump electrical power in when B is setback (W).
525        // (HEAT_PUMP_POWER_IN_B_SETBACK_W)
526        // Note that flow and mean temperatures seem to be being mixed here in the HG page.
527        final double DCoPsb = computeFlowCoP(DradAMWsb + CoPCorrectionK);
528//System.out.println(String.format("CoPsb = %f", CoPsb));
529        final double DHPinWsb =
530                DHHLsb / DCoPsb;
531
532
533        final HeatAndElectricityDemand noSetback = new HeatAndElectricityDemand(DHHLnsb, DHPinWnsb);
534        final HeatAndElectricityDemand withSetback = new HeatAndElectricityDemand(DHHLsb, DHPinWsb);
535
536        // Return everything at once.
537        return(new DemandWithoutAndWithSetback(noSetback, withSetback));
538            }
539
540
541    /**Compute raw heat and heat-pump electricity demand with and without setback, for 'soft' A temperature regulation (W).
542     * This lets the A room temperature droop during B-room setback,
543     * and does not raise the flow temperature.
544     * <p>
545     * This assumes that:
546     * <ul>
547     * <li>B room temperatures (and A room temperatures) are 'normal' (21C) without setback.</li>
548     * <li>B room temperatures are the expected 18C when set back.</li>
549     * <li>Flow temperature is pinned during setback to the temperature
550     *     that maintained A and B rooms at 'normal' temperature without setback,
551     *     ie as if the flow temperature is entirely driven by external temperature
552     *     and thus weather compensation.</li>
553     * </ul>
554     * <p>
555     * Note: this does not allow for the temperature delta across the radiator rising,
556     * and thus the mean water (MW) temperature dropping further from the flow temperature,
557     * as more heat is drawn by an A room below 'normal' temperature.
558     * <p>
559     * This shows the change in heat and electrical demand from a house with no rooms set back
560     * to when B rooms are set back.
561     *
562     * @param params  the variable model parameters
563     * @param bungalow  if true, compute as 4-room bungalow, else as 2-storey 8-room detached
564     * @param equilibriumTemperature  if not null and not zero length,
565     *     used to return the A-room equilibrium temperature
566     * @return demand in watts, finite and non-negative
567     */
568    public static DemandWithoutAndWithSetback computeSoftATempDemandW(final ModelParameters params,
569                final boolean bungalow,
570                final double[] equilibriumTemperature)
571            {
572        Objects.requireNonNull(params);
573
574        // Do not allow model to be run with potentially implausible parameters.
575        if(params.externalAirTemperatureC >= HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)
576            { throw new UnsupportedOperationException("model may not work when outside is warmer than setback rooms"); }
577
578
579        // Roof area: as for bungalow.
580        final double roofAreaM2 = HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.HOME_TOTAL_ROOF_AREA_M2;
581
582        // Number of rooms.
583        final int numRooms = bungalow ? 4 : 8;
584
585        // External wall area: as for bungalow in bungalow mode, else double.
586        final double extWallAreaM2 = (bungalow ? 1 : 2) *
587                        HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.HOME_TOTAL_EXTERNAL_WALL_AREA_M2;
588
589        // Wall heat loss per K temperature differential between inside and out.
590        final double homeHeatLossPerK = (roofAreaM2 + extWallAreaM2) *
591                        HGTRVHPMModelExtensions.HOME_LOSSLESS_FLOOR_EXTERNAL_WALL_AND_ROOF_U_WpM2K;
592
593        // DHHLnsb: whole home heat loss with no setback (all rooms same temperature) and given external air temperature (W).
594        final double DHHLnsb = (HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
595                        homeHeatLossPerK;
596//System.out.println(String.format("DHHLnsb = %.1f", DHHLnsb));
597
598        // DradWnsb: pre-setback radiator output based on variable external air temperature (W).
599                final double DradWnsb = DHHLnsb / numRooms;
600//System.out.println(String.format("DradWnsb = %f", DradWnsb));
601
602                // Extension to heat loss 2 to allow for varying external temperatures.
603                // MW temperature for all room radiators with no setbacks.
604        final double DradAMWnsb = nsbAMW(DradWnsb);
605//System.out.println(String.format("DradAnsbMW = %.1f", DradAnsbMW));
606        // Delta between radiator mean water (MW) and A room air with no setbacks.
607                final double DradAdTnsb = DradAMWnsb - HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C;
608//System.out.println(String.format("DradAdTsb = %.1fK", DradAdTsb));
609
610        // Compute correction for across-radiator delta-T if needed.
611        final double CoPCorrectionK = params.correctCoPForFlowVsMW() ? flowMWDelta_K : 0;
612
613                // HPinWnsb: (Heat Pump Efficiency) heat-pump electrical power in when B not setback (W).
614        // (HEAT_PUMP_POWER_IN_NO_SETBACK_W)
615        // Note that flow and mean temperatures seem to be being mixed here in the HG page.
616        final double DCoPnsb = computeFlowCoP(DradAMWnsb + CoPCorrectionK);
617        final double VCoPsb = DCoPnsb;
618//System.out.println(String.format("DCoPnsb = VCoPsb = %f", DCoPnsb));
619        final double DHPinWnsb =
620                DHHLnsb / DCoPnsb;
621//System.out.println(String.format("DHPinWnsb = %f", DHPinWnsb));
622
623        // Compute losses to outside for all B rooms when B setback.
624        final double VBHLsb = (HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
625                        (homeHeatLossPerK / 2);
626//System.out.println(String.format("VBHLsb = %.1fW (%.1fW per B room))", VBHLsb, VBHLsb / (numRooms / 2)));
627
628
629        // A-room temperature step in K.
630        final double tempStepK = 0.01;
631
632        // Try all A room temperatures from setback up to and just above 'normal'
633        // to find the minimum A room temperature where heat gains equal or exceed losses
634        // and the whole house heat loss at that point.
635        double VequilibriumTempA = 0;
636        double VequilibriumHHLsb = 0;
637        for(double tempA = HGTRVHPMModel.SETBACK_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C;
638                        tempA <= HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C + tempStepK;
639                        tempA += tempStepK)
640                {
641//System.out.println(String.format("tempA = %.1fC", tempA));
642
643                // Compute losses to outside for all A rooms when B setback.
644                final double VAHLsb = (tempA - params.externalAirTemperatureC()) *
645                        (homeHeatLossPerK / 2);
646//System.out.println(String.format("  VAHLsb = %.1fW", VAHLsb));
647                final double VHHLsb = VAHLsb+VBHLsb;
648//System.out.println(String.format("  VHHLsb = %.1fW", VHHLsb));
649
650                        // Losses to outside for each A room.
651                        final double VAHLo = VAHLsb / (numRooms / 2);
652//System.out.println(String.format("  VAHLo = %.1fW", VAHLo));
653
654                // HEAT LOSS 1
655                // Internal wall heat loss/transfer per A room (W).
656                final double VIWAabHLW = iwHeatLossPerA(params, tempA);
657                // Internal floor/ceiling heat loss/transfer per A room (W).
658                // None if a bungalow or if AABB arrangement on both floors,
659                // ie no A and B share a ceiling/floor.
660                final double VIFAabHLW =
661                        (bungalow || !params.roomsAlternatingABAB) ? 0 :
662                                ifHeatLossPerA2Storey(params, tempA);
663            // All internal heat losses per A room (W).
664                final double VIFWAabHLW = VIWAabHLW + VIFAabHLW;
665//System.out.println(String.format("  VIFWAabHLW = %.1fW", VIFWAabHLW));
666
667                        // Total heat losses from each A room.
668            final double VAHLW = VIFWAabHLW + VAHLo;
669//System.out.println(String.format("  VAHLW = %.1fW", VAHLW));
670
671            // Input power from radiator to each A room given:
672            //   * the A room temperature
673            //   * same (weather-compensated) MW/flow temperature as without setbacks
674            //
675            // Delta between radiator mean water (MW) and A room air.
676                        final double VradAdTsb = DradAMWnsb - tempA;
677                        assert((VradAdTsb > DradAdTnsb) || (tempA >= HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)) :
678                                "When room is cooler than 'normal', delta must be higher.";
679//System.out.println(String.format("  VradAdTsb = %.1fK", VradAdT));
680            // Ratio to original non-setback delta.
681            final double VradAdTmultsb = VradAdTsb / DradAdTnsb;
682//System.out.println(String.format("  VradAdTmultsb = %.2f", VradAdTmultsb));
683            final double dtToWexp = 1 / HGTRVHPMModel.RADIATOR_EXP_POWER_TO_DT;
684                        // Power output from rad in A room.
685            final double VradWAmultsb =
686                        VradAdTmultsb * Math.pow(VradAdTmultsb, dtToWexp);
687//System.out.println(String.format("  VradWAmultsb = %.2f", VradWAmult));
688                        // Power output from rad in A room (with B set back).
689                        final double VradWAsb =
690                                VradWAmultsb * DradWnsb;
691//System.out.println(String.format("  VradWAsb = %.1fW", VradWAsb));
692            // When room is cooler than 'normal', radiator output must be higher.
693                        assert((VradWAsb > DradWnsb) || (tempA >= HGTRVHPMModel.NORMAL_ROOM_TEMPERATURE_C)) :
694                                "When room is cooler than 'normal', radiator output must be higher.";
695
696            // Compute the error in each A-room heat gains and losses (+ve means excess heat in).
697            final double VAHLerrW =
698                        VradWAsb - VAHLW;
699//System.out.println(String.format("  VAHLerrW = %.1fW", VAHLerrW));
700
701            // Stop when A-room losses exceed gains
702                        // thus returning (conservative, near) equilibrium values
703            // from the previous step.
704            //
705            // As the A room trial temperature rises with each loop iteration,
706            // losses will rise.
707                        if(VAHLerrW < 0)
708                                { break; }
709
710                        // Record temperature and home heat loss
711                        // when room A temperature below equilibrium point.
712                        VequilibriumTempA = tempA;
713                        VequilibriumHHLsb = VHHLsb;
714                }
715
716        if(VequilibriumHHLsb <= 0)
717            { throw new RuntimeException("Failed to find solution"); }
718
719        // Return equilibrium temperature if possible.
720        if((null != equilibriumTemperature) && (0 != equilibriumTemperature.length))
721                { equilibriumTemperature[0] = VequilibriumTempA; }
722
723//System.out.println(String.format("VequilibriumTempA = %.1fC @ external %.1fC", VequilibriumTempA, params.externalAirTemperatureC()));
724
725        // Compute electrical energy in given non-setback flow temperature CoP.
726        final double VHPinWsb =
727                VequilibriumHHLsb / VCoPsb;
728//System.out.println(String.format("VHPinWsb = %.1fW", VHPinWsb));
729//System.out.println(String.format("DHPinWnsb = %.1fW", DHPinWnsb));
730
731        final HeatAndElectricityDemand noSetback = new HeatAndElectricityDemand(DHHLnsb, DHPinWnsb);
732        final HeatAndElectricityDemand withSetback = new HeatAndElectricityDemand(VequilibriumHHLsb, VHPinWsb);
733
734        // Return everything at once.
735        return(new DemandWithoutAndWithSetback(noSetback, withSetback));
736            }
737
738        }
